Comment: Why does everyone say 51st State?  Canada has Provinces & Territories, we have States & Territories here in the US. It would only be fair if each Province became a State. Right?    So they’d become 10 States, one for each Province. That means 20 Senators, and they’d get a fair share of Congressional Reps too.  Enough to change the balance of Congress.

Author: Detox208

Comment: Carney has his own duty to appear strong and show his people that he is representing their interests.   Most Canadians still want to be our neighbors, and still they want to work with us.   They also want to see their leaders standing up to us when ours act like bullies, not avoid interacting with them. Because that’s what it is going to take to mend the friendship and partnership our nations have had for generations.   Carney knows nothing productive will come out of a meeting with a man like Trump, unless he gives Trump something he wants. But he made it very clear he’s not going to just hand over the keys to the kingdom. That was the real purpose behind that meeting.  Nothing upsets and destabilizes Trump more than when a real adult in the room treats him like an adult, with respect but firmness. Men like Trump don’t know how to deal with that because they hate facing accountability for their behavior. At a glance it may not seem like indulging Trump for a meeting really does that on its own, but the point is not that they had a meeting.   The point is that Carney directly confronted Trump over his shenanigans while going out of his way to show him that Carney is not going to give him the response he wanted. He’s not going to get upset or unbalanced like Trump would. He’s going to act like an actual head of state and keep his composure. It’s a good way to deal with a person like that, for a lot of reasons. Not sure if one would say it’s a perfect political strategy, but I think I see the angle he is playing at there, considering how many Canadians (and Americans) are already fairly upset with him. He doesn’t need to add fuel on the fire or act all tough. Trump is more than capable of undermining himself on his own, obviously. He’s playing the long game in that sense.
Author: nikolai_470000
